Authors:
Danushka Sandaruwan Tennakoon, Chang-Hsin Kuo, Rajesh
JEEWON, Kasun Madhusanka Thambugala, T. K. Goh, Kevin D Hyde
Title:
Pseudolophiostoma mangiferae sp. nov. & Vaginatispora
fuckelii, a new record from Mangifera indica
Keywords:
Dothideomycetes, new species, phylogeny, taxonomy,
saprobes
Abstract:
Pseudolophiostoma mangiferae, isolated from a dead stem of
Mangifera indica, collected in Fanlu Township area, Dahu village in
Chiayi, Taiwan (Elevation 634 m) and is introduced as a new species
based on morphological data and DNA sequence analyses. Maximum
parsimony, Maximum likelihood and Bayesian Inference analyses of
combined ITS, LSU, SSU and tef1-Î± sequence data were performed to
clarify the phylogenetic affinities of the species. Pseudolophiostoma
mangiferae is distinguished from the type species, P. vitigenum based on
size of ascomata, asci, ascospores and phylogenetic inferences. In
addition, Vaginatispora fuckelii is described as a new record from
Taiwan. Both isolates are compared with other similar species and
comprehensive descriptions and micrographs are provided.
